perturbationx.io.RelationTranslator

Module Contents

Classes

RelationTranslator

Class for translating relations to numeric values. By default, relations "1", "increases", "->",
class perturbationx.io.RelationTranslator.RelationTranslator(mappings=None, allow_numeric=True)

Class for translating relations to numeric values. By default, relations “1”, “increases”, “->”, “directlyIncreases”, and “=>” are mapped to 1.0, while relations “-1”, “decreases”, “-|”, “directlyDecreases”, and “=|” are mapped to -1.0. Relations that cannot be mapped to a numeric value will be parsed as 0.0.

Parameters:

  • mappings (dict, optional) – Dictionary of additional relation to numeric value mappings. It extends and overrides the default mappings.

  • allow_numeric (bool, optional) – If True, relations will be parsed as numeric values if they cannot be found in the mappings dictionary. Defaults to True.

add_mapping(relation, maps_to)

Add a new mapping from a relation to a numeric value.

Parameters:

  • relation (str) – The relation to map.

  • maps_to (float) – The numeric value to map to.

remove_mapping(relation)

Remove a mapping from a relation to a numeric value.

Parameters:

relation (str) – The relation to remove the mapping for.

copy()

Create a copy of this RelationTranslator.

Returns:

A copy of this RelationTranslator.

Return type:

RelationTranslator

translate(relation)

Translate a relation to a numeric value.

Parameters:

relation (str) – The relation to translate.

Returns:

The numeric value that the relation maps to.

Return type:

float
